item.title: 投资者如何购买黄金以及黄金市场的驱动因素
item.description: 周五，黄金创下每盎司 2,600 美元以上的历史新高，因为美国进一步降息的前景和全球地缘政治的不确定性增强了黄金的吸引力。【原文：Gold hit a record high above $2,600 per ounce on Friday, as the prospect of more U.S. interest rate cuts and global geo-political uncertainty boosted its appeal.】

item.title: 锁定期满，特朗普媒体下滑
item.description: Truth Social 母公司 Trump Media & Technology Group 的股票在周五的盘前交易中下跌了 4.5%，原因是该公司对内线销售的锁定期到期，从而延续了本周的大幅下挫。【原文：Shares of Trump Media & Technology Group fell 4.5% in premarket trading on Friday as the Truth Social parent extended this week's steep selloff after a lock-up on insider sales expired.】

item.title: 美联储将在 11 月和 12 月降息 25 个基点，更快接近中性水平
item.description: 路透社的一项即时调查显示，100 多位经济学家中的绝大多数认为，美国联邦储备委员会将在 11 月和 12 月把联邦基金利率下调 25 个基点。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will cut the federal funds rate by 25 basis points in both November and December, according to a strong majority of over 100 economists in a snap Reuters poll.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利因中国、内存和英特尔问题下调 ASML 评级
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）周五下调了计算机芯片设备制造商ASML的盈利预期，这是继内存芯片市场疲软以及对中国芯片制造商和英特尔需求的担忧之后，最新一家下调预期的券商。【原文：Morgan Stanley on Friday downgraded earnings estimates for computer chip equipment maker ASML , the latest brokerage to do so following weakness in the memory chip market and concerns over demand from Chinese chipmakers and Intel .】

item.title: 加拿大银行：人工智能可能在短期内提升通胀压力
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 诺基亚称德国法院在其与亚马逊的专利纠纷中作出有利于其的裁决
item.description: 芬兰网络设备制造商和电信专利持有者诺基亚周五表示，慕尼黑一家法院裁定亚马逊在未获得许可的情况下使用了诺基亚的专利视频技术。【原文：A Munich court has ruled that Amazon is using Nokia's patented video technologies without a license, the Finnish network equipment maker and telecommunications patent holder said on Friday.】

item.title: 印度 Nifty 指数和 Sensex 指数表现优于全球大多数市场，仅次于华尔街
item.description: 印度 NSE Nifty 50 指数和 S&P BSE Sensex 指数是今年表现最好的指数，仅次于华尔街的纳斯达克指数和 S&P 500 指数。【原文：India's NSE Nifty 50 and S&P BSE Sensex are trailing only Wall Street's Nasdaq and S&P 500 as top-performing indexes this year, with analysts expecting the rally to extend into 2025.】

item.title: 越南电动汽车制造商 VinFast 报告连续亏损扩大
item.description: 越南电动汽车制造商 VinFast 周五公布的财报显示，尽管其收入仍呈上升趋势，但受其雄心勃勃的亚洲扩张所导致的成本上升影响，第二季度亏损加剧。【原文：Vietnamese electric-vehicle maker VinFast reported a deeper second-quarter loss on Friday, driven by rising costs linked to its ambitious Asia expansion, although its revenue remained on a rising trend, according to its exchange filing.】

item.title: 美国公司将在假日季节雇佣数千名季节性工人
item.description: 从塔吉特（Target）、梅西百货（Macy's）到包裹递送公司 UPS 等美国公司都计划在最重要的假日季节到来之前雇佣数千名季节性工人。【原文：U.S. companies from Target and Macy's to package delivery firm UPS plan to hire thousands of seasonal workers ahead of the all-important holiday season.】

item.title: 华尔街因美联储政策转向而反弹后期货暂停
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货走低，暂停了前一交易日的涨势，在美联储本周早些时候对货币政策采取关键立场后，华尔街主要股指有望实现周涨幅。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged lower on Friday, taking a pause from the previous session's rally that set Wall Street's main indexes on track for weekly gains after the Federal Reserve took a pivotal stance on monetary policy earlier in the week.】

item.title: 致命洪灾加剧中欧财政压力
item.description: 就在一周前，在致命的洪水席卷中欧之前，捷克共和国似乎有望成为自 COVID-19 以来该地区第一个将预算赤字控制在欧盟规定的国内生产总值 3% 上限以下的国家。【原文：Just a week ago, before deadly floods swept through central Europe, the Czech Republic looked on track to become the first country in the region since COVID-19 to pull its budget deficit firmly below the 3% of GDP cap set by European Union rules.】

item.title: 巴西的在线赌博热可能会影响消费者支出
item.description: 痴迷足球的巴西人对在线体育博彩情有独钟，外国博彩公司对此兴趣浓厚，这可能会增加国库收入，但也有可能转移其他领域的消费支出。【原文：Soccer-mad Brazilians have fallen hard for online sports betting, yielding a boom of interest from foreign gambling companies that may boost state coffers but also threatens to divert funds from consumer spending in other areas.】

item.title: 2023 年多边银行提供的气候融资将达到 1 250 亿美元
item.description: 周五的一份报告显示，来自多边开发银行的全球气候融资在2023年增长了25%，达到创纪录的1250亿美元，其中增长最快的是富裕国家。【原文：Global climate finance from multilateral development banks grew by 25% in 2023 to a record $125 billion, according to a report on Friday, with the fastest growth coming in richer countries.】

item.title: 早间投标：美联储光芒四射，日本/中国按兵不动后的盘点
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美联储降息后，投资顾问敦促客户远离现金
item.description: 鉴于美联储已开始实施备受期待的利率宽松政策，投资顾问们正敦促客户放弃大量现金配置，他们预计这一进程将在未来几个月内限制货币市场基金的吸引力。【原文：Investment advisers are urging clients to dump hefty cash allocations now that the Federal Reserve has begun its much-anticipated interest-rate easing, a process they expect to limit the appeal of money-market funds in the coming months.】

item.title: 赛诺菲公司称托乐替尼药物可将进展性多发性硬化症的治疗时间推迟31
item.description: 赛诺菲公司周五表示，其多发性硬化症候选药物被证明可将一种进行性疾病的恶化程度延缓31%，这家法国制药商正准备在今年晚些时候申请批准。【原文：Sanofi said on Friday that its multiple sclerosis drug candidate was shown to delay worsening of a progressive form of the disease by 31%, as the French drugmaker eyes a request for approval later this year.】

item.title: 耐克新任首席执行官在推动销售复兴时可能会寻求修复与零售商的关系
item.description: 业内专家周五表示，耐克新任首席执行官很可能会把重点放在修复与零售商的关系上，以促进需求，而这一战略在即将离任的首席执行官约翰-多纳霍（John Donahoe）的领导下被置于次要地位。【原文：Nike's new CEO will likely focus on repairing relations with retailers to boost demand, a strategy that took a back seat under outgoing chief John Donahoe, industry experts said on Friday.】

item.title: 通用汽车将在美国召回超过 449,000 辆皮卡和 SUV
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，由于制动液过低警报失灵，通用汽车公司将在美国召回449671辆皮卡和SUV。【原文：General Motors is recalling 449,671 pickup trucks and SUVs in the U.S. due to inoperative low brake fluid warning, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 福特因后视摄像头图像冻结召回超过 14.4 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，福特汽车公司将在美国召回超过14.4万辆2022-2024年款福特Maverick汽车，原因是该车在倒车时后视摄像头图像冻结。【原文：Ford Motor is recalling over 144,000 2022-2024 Ford Maverick vehicles in the U.S. citing rearview camera image freezing when the vehicle is in reverse, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 三星警告印度罢工工人 "不工作就没工资"，罢工事件不断升级
item.description: 三星电子公司的一封电子邮件显示，该公司已警告印度南部的罢工工人，如果他们继续抗议，将领不到工资，还将面临被解雇的风险，这使得该公司与员工之间的纠纷升级。【原文：Samsung Electronics has warned its striking workers in southern India they will not receive wages if they continue protesting and also face the risk of termination, a company email showed, escalating a dispute between the company and its employees.】

item.title: 银行员工和工会警告：德国必须反对联合信贷银行收购德国商业银行
item.description: 德国商业银行（Commerzbank）员工和一个著名工会周五呼吁德国政府反对意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）收购这家德国银行。【原文：Commerzbank employees and a prominent labour union on Friday called on the German government to oppose a takeover of the German lender by Italy's UniCredit .】

item.title: 优先快递需求疲软，联邦快递股价暴跌
item.description: 联邦快递公司（FedEx Corp）周五股价暴跌，此前这家包裹巨头下调了年度收入预期，并报告称利润大幅下降，原因是对高利润快速递送服务的需求疲软。【原文：FedEx Corp shares slumped on Friday after the parcel giant cut its annual revenue forecast and reported a sharp fall in profits, owing to weak demand for high-margin speedy delivery services.】

item.title: 美国将为电池制造业的 25 个项目拨款 30 亿美元
item.description: 美国能源部周五表示，计划向 14 个州的 25 个电池制造业项目拨款 30 亿美元，拜登政府正努力将供应链从中国转移出去。【原文：The U.S. Energy Department said Friday it plans to award $3 billion to 25 battery manufacturing sector projects in 14 states as the Biden administration works to shift the supply chain away from China.】

item.title: 科技巨头推动淡化欧洲人工智能法案
item.description: 全球最大的科技公司已开始最后的努力，说服欧盟对人工智能采取轻触式的监管方式，以避免数十亿美元的罚款风险。【原文：The world's biggest technology companies have embarked on a final push to persuade the European Union to take a light-touch approach to regulating artificial intelligence as they seek to fend off the risk of billions of dollars in fines.】

item.title: 据 RBC 报道，俄罗斯正在讨论大幅提高外国公司的 "退出税
item.description: 俄罗斯广播公司（RBC）日报周五援引四位消息人士的话报道称，俄罗斯当局正在讨论将离开该国的外国公司必须向国家预算缴纳的一次性会费从 15%提高到 40%。【原文：Russian authorities are discussing raising the one-off contribution that foreign companies leaving the country must make to the state budget to as high as 40% from 15%, the RBC daily reported on Friday, citing four sources.】

item.title: 新日铁在美国钢铁交易中出售 2.11 亿美元资产以管理债务
item.description: 日经新闻》周五援引新日铁副董事长的话称，新日铁计划在本财年出售至少 300 亿日元（2.11 亿美元）的资产，以管理债务，同时等待 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司的结果。【原文：Nippon Steel plans to sell at least 30 billion yen ($211 million) in assets in this fiscal year to manage its debt, the Nikkei quoted its vice chairman as saying on Friday, as it waits to know the fate of its $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel .】

item.title: 汉莎航空考虑因竞争取消法兰克福-北京航线
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司发言人周五表示，由于竞争加剧，尤其是来自中国的竞争加剧，以及在欧洲开展业务的成本增加，汉莎航空公司的底线受到冲击，因此该公司正在评估是否取消法兰克福至北京的每日航班。【原文：Germany's Lufthansa is evaluating whether to cancel its daily Frankfurt-to-Beijing flights as increased competition, particularly from China, and higher costs of doing business in Europe hit its bottom line, a spokesperson said on Friday.】

item.title: 日本央行行长上田在新闻发布会上的讲话
item.description: 日本央行周五维持利率稳定，并上调了对消费的评估，表明其对经济稳健复苏的信心将允许央行在未来几个月再次加息。【原文：The Bank of Japan kept interest rates steady on Friday and revised up its assessment on consumption, signalling its confidence a solid economic recovery will allow the central bank to raise interest rates again in coming months.】

item.title: 地铁运营商东京地铁启动 22.5 亿美元首次公开募股
item.description: 地铁运营商东京地铁周五表示，该公司计划于 10 月 23 日在东京证券交易所上市，为日本约六年来最大规模的首次公开募股（IPO）创造条件。【原文：Subway operator Tokyo Metro said on Friday it plans to list on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on Oct. 23, setting the stage for what would be Japan's largest initial public offering (IPO) in about six years.】

item.title: 消息人士称，因香港上市受挫，中国政府叫停泡沫红茶离岸IPO审批
item.description: 八名消息人士称，由于国内消费者情绪疲软，香港同行市场表现低迷，至少三家中国泡沫红茶制造商的境外股票发行计划已被证券监管机构搁置。【原文：Offshore share offering plans of at least three Chinese bubble tea makers have been put on hold by the securities regulator due to the dour market performance of peers in Hong Kong amid weaker consumer sentiment at home, said eight sources.】
